Logan_Brill:
{{Use mdy dates|date=August 2022}} {{Short description|American singer-songwriter}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Logan Brill | image = Logan Brill.JPG | image_size = | birth_name = Katherine Logan Brill | birth_place = [[Knoxville, Tennessee]], U.S. | occupation = Singer, songwriter | label = [[Carnival Music]] | website = {{URL|loganbrill.com}} {{MusicBrainz artist|id=b97912c5-c168-476b-b89e-070442d7d4f2|name=Logan Brill}} }} ''' Katherine Logan Brill''' is an American singer and songwriter from [[Knoxville, Tennessee]]. She currently writes for [[Carnival Music]] and released her debut album, ''Walking Wires'' (Carnival Recording Company), in October 2013. Her musical style has been described as a combination of [[country music|country]], [[American folk music|roots]], [[blues]], and [[Americana music|Americana]]. == Biography == Born in Knoxville, Tennessee, Brill was exposed to a variety of music growing up: artists such as [[Jackson Browne]], the [[Grateful Dead]], [[Stevie Ray Vaughan]], and [[Patty Griffin]].{{cite web|url=http://www.suntimes.com/entertainment/music/22926573-421/story.html#.U1aiiVeypnK|title=Logan Brill's busy carving her own path |work=[[Chicago Sun-Times]]|date=October 2, 2013|accessdate=April 22, 2014}} While none of her family were professional musicians, they were all music lovers. After dinner they would frequently have family "jam sessions."[http://www.pollstar.com/news_article.aspx?ID=808775 Meet Logan Brill | Pollstar] In her teens, Brill continued to expand musically by playing in her brother's jazz band. At 18, she moved to [[Nashville, Tennessee]], to pursue an education at [[Belmont University]]. Not wanting to limit herself to music, she earned a degree in French with a minor in vocal performance. After a friend introduced her to workers at [[Carnival Music]], Brill signed with the label in early 2012.{{cite web|url=http://www.knoxville.com/news/2014/mar/28/knoxville-music-logan-brill-rhythm-blooms-2014/?print=1|title=Knoxville's Logan Brill is finding her place in the Nashville scene|work=[[Knoxville News Sentinel]]|date=March 28, 2014|accessdate=April 22, 2014}} Brill's debut album, ''Walking Wires'', was released on October 15, 2013.{{cite magazine|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/the-615/5740652/logan-brill-scars-exclusive-video-premiere|title=Logan Brill, 'Scars': Exclusive Video Premiere|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=September 30, 2013|accessdate=April 22, 2014}}{{cite web|url=http://theboot.com/logan-brill-bad-habits-song-premiere/|title=Logan Brill, 'Bad Habits' – Exclusive Song Premiere|publisher=The Boot|date=August 29, 2013|accessdate=April 22, 2014}}{{cite web|url=http://www.roughstock.com/audio/audio-track-logan-brill-seven-year-rain|title=Audio Track: Logan Brill – Seven Year Rain|publisher=Roughstock|date=September 12, 2013|accessdate=April 22, 2014|archive-url=https://archive.today/20140421233336/http://www.roughstock.com/audio/audio-track-logan-brill-seven-year-rain|archive-date=April 21, 2014|url-status=dead}}{{cite web|url=http://www.engine145.com/song-premiere-logan-brill-nobodys-crying/|title=Song Premiere: Logan Brill — "Nobody's Crying"|publisher=Engine 145|date=October 2, 2013|accessdate=April 22, 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141021021331/http://www.engine145.com/song-premiere-logan-brill-nobodys-crying/|archive-date=October 21, 2014|url-status=dead}} It features ten tracks and was produced by Oran Thorton and Matthew Miller. Two of her songs have been featured on the [[VH1]] [[reality show]], ''[[Couples Therapy (2012 TV series)|Couples Therapy]]''. "Scars" was featured on season four (episode six), "Rewind" was featured on season 4 (episode 3).[https://web.archive.org/web/20140122125754/http://www.vh1.com/shows/music/couples-therapy/season-4-episode-3-songs/ Couples Therapy Season 4 Episode 3 Songs] Both are included on ''Walking Wires''. She also recorded and a released the single, "Wailing Wall", in a partnership with Massachusetts-based charity organization, Montachusett Veterans' Outreach Center, drawing attention to women Veterans' issues with proceeds of sales benefiting MVOC.{{Cite web|url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/wailing-wall-single/id921908990|title = Wailing Wall – Single by Logan Brill|website = [[iTunes]]|date = September 23, 2014}} Logan has appeared since her release on sold-out bills in markets from Nashville to Chicago to Washington, DC, including acoustic opening spots with artists like [[Steve Earle]], [[Josh Turner]], [[Jerry Douglas]], [[Leon Russell]], [[Ashley Monroe]], [[Gary Allan]], and [[Todd Snider]], as well as with her band at national concert events like Virginia Beach's Patriotic Festival with [[The Band Perry]] and Cincinnati's first annual Buckle Up Festival with headliners [[Alison Krauss]], [[Willie Nelson]], & [[David Nail]]. Brill released her second album, ''Shuteye'', on June 2, 2015, and it sold 1,100 copies on its debut week.{{cite news|title=Country Album Chart Report For June 11, 2015|url=http://roughstock.com/news/2015/06/35685-country-album-chart-report-june-11-2015/ |last= Bjorke|first=Matt |publisher=Roughstock |date= June 11, 2015 }} Sales figure given [https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/172kLuk5hsRAaHdkBYmwgmDq8cQPE4FyDRaZslZpUxNQ/edit#gid=0 here] She also performed at North Carolina's famed roots festival, [[Merlefest]], California's largest Country Music Festival, [[Stagecoach Festival|Stagecoach]], making her [[Grand Ole Opry]] debut, and touring appearances with icons [[Merle Haggard]] and [[Dwight Yoakam]]. == Critical reception == ''The Nashville Sound'' rated ''Walking Wires'' as its 6th best album of the year. They added "The minute the album starts out with the outstanding track,'There's No Such Things As Ghosts,' the listener recognizes the power in the album. The sound is fresh and the lyrics are poignant. At only 22, her storytelling belies her age. The depth of the emotions conveyed through the performances relate well to her soulful voice, particularly when singing of loss and heartache."[http://thatnashvillesound.blogspot.com/2013/12/that-nashville-sounds-top-albums-of-2013.html "That Nashville Sound's Top Albums of 2013"] ''That Nashville Sound'' ''[[Country Music Association|CMA]] Close Up'' Magazine featured Brill in its "debut spotlight" section in November 2013. They said Brill "mixes earthy and ethereal narratives with sharp storytelling. Edge and energy frame her elegant sense of lyric."[http://www.cmacloseup.com/2013/11/26/logan-brill-debut-spotlight/ "Logan Brill: Debut Spotlight"] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140426232413/http://www.cmacloseup.com/2013/11/26/logan-brill-debut-spotlight/ |date=April 26, 2014 }} ''CMA Close Up'' Magazine ''[[Country Weekly]]'' advised its readers to "Check out this premiere of the melancholy 'Rewind'".{{cite news|url=http://www.countryweekly.com/music/track-premiere-logan-brills-rewind|title=Track Premiere: Logan Brill's "Rewind" |work=Country Weekly|date=September 27, 2013|accessdate=April 21, 2014}} == Discography == === Albums === {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2" style="width:10em;"| Title ! rowspan="2" style="width:20em;"| Album details ! colspan="2"| Peak chart
